newsitem.title: USA: Seattle-Tacoma becomes economic leader - report.
newsitem.headline: Seattle-Tacoma becomes economic leader - report.

text.p: Surging commercial aircraft orders and increased production and hiring in aerospace transformed Seattle-Tacoma into one of the strongest metro economies in the United States, according to a report released Tuesday.
Employment in the Seattle-Tacoma area was up 5.0 percent from a year ago, Bank of America regional economist Howard Roth said in the report.
The improved job market has boosted personal income as well as home and retail sales, he said.
Total manufacturing jobs in Seattle-Tacoma grew nearly 11 percent from February 1996 to February 1997 after falling more than 2.0 percent in the previous year period, the report said.
Employers in both manufacturing and the services sector are now finding it difficult to find qualified employees, the report said.
"With increases in commercial aircraft production and computer services expanding further this year, labor markets in Seattle-Tacoma will remain tight for some time," Roth said.
The report, titled "Economic & Business Outlook -- 1997 Regional Outlook," was produced by the Economics and Policy Research Department at Bank of America, a unit of BankAmerica Corp.
